instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing backlight, <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>?
threads.message:
Liquid damage around J5250

Was turning on but no image.
Replaced damaged J5250, <RESISTOR>R5250</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C5250</CAPACITOR>.
Now got image and backlight but after a few secs backlight is pulsing and once lid is closed and open there is no image so it think the lid is closed.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing backlight, <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>?
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> level in that moment.
You can remove <RESISTOR>R5250</RESISTOR> and check if image is stable.

Probably corroded solders/traces at J5250.
You can run wires from Hall sensor IC directly to the board; 3V42, ground and lid signal...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> pulsing backlight, <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>?
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5250</RESISTOR> removed and backlight was solid, no pulses.

Corroded trace - 3V42 to J5250.

Fixed now - many thank for help.
